newsitem.title: USA: Texas Instruments Thai investor end ventures.
newsitem.headline: Texas Instruments Thai investor end ventures.

text.p: Texas Instruments Inc and Charn Uswachoke, a leading Thai electronics entrepreneur, said Thursday they have terminated joint venture agreements involving Alpha-TI Semiconductors Co Ltd, and Alpha Memory Co Ltd, in Thailand.

In a statement, Texas Instruments said it elected to terminate the ventures due to difficult economic conditions in Thailand that have affected Uswachoke's financing capabilities. Under an agreement, Uswachoke will purchase Texas Instrument's stake in the joint ventures, the U.S. company said.

Texas Instruments said it expects to take a special charge against earnings in the second quarter of 1997 to reflect costs associated with the joint ventures. Officials of Texas Instruments were not available for comment.
"A number of factors drove our financial constraints, including a significant slowdown in the Thai economy and subsequent decline in the Thai stock market," said Uswachoke.
He said his conglomerate, Alphatec Group is aggressively pursuing alternative means for completing and continuing facilities of the two joint ventures, independent of TI.
The ongoing manufacturing services relationship between Alphatec Electronics PLC and Texas Instruments is not affected by termination of the joint venture agreements, the U.S. company said.
